subject: Cosmonauts bypass power switch, reboot computers

Cosmonauts bypass power switch, reboot computers





Two Russian cosmonauts began to get crucial computers up and running Friday,
four days after they crashed at the international space station and curbed the
outpost's ability to orient itself and produce oxygen.





FULL STORY

Arab League calls for Palestinian unity





The Arab League called Friday "on all parties to stop the fighting on
Palestinian lands" and return the government to its status before Hamas forces
claimed full control of Gaza.

Storms threaten Southern Plains, Southeast





Low-pressure systems were expected to cause thunderstorms in the Southern
Plains and Southeast on Friday. The West was expected to remain generally
clear.

Car sought for clues to woman's Florida disappearance





Police in South Florida are searching hundreds of canals and a huge area of
wetlands for a car that could provide vital clues in the case of a young woman
who vanished three weeks ago.





FULL STORY
















2nd Minnesota sextuplet dies





A second sextuplet born prematurely to a Minnesota couple has died, hospital
officials said Friday.





FULL STORY
















Police: Wounded father not a suspect in family's killings





Police say the only survivor of a shooting that left his wife and three
children dead in their sport utility vehicle was questioned and is not a
suspect in the attack.





FULL STORY
















It'll be tough to jumpstart classic car after 50-year burial





Calling it "our King Tut's tomb," thousands of people watched as a 1957
Plymouth Belvedere was pulled from the ground where it had been buried for 50
years as a time capsule of American Midwest culture.

Shantytowns springing up in Iraq





Iraqis fleeing their homes because of sectarian warfare are starting to set up
their own makeshift camps inside the country, a development reflecting the
dire scope of the country's population displacement problem.





FULL STORY
















Hezbollah detain Lebanese police





In an incident described as the first of its kind, Hezbollah gunmen surrounded
a Lebanese police patrol Friday and held them for "entering a Hezbollah
security zone."





FULL STORY
















PM meets Dalai Lama to talk Tibet





The Dalai Lama has met with Australia's prime minister, whose decision this
week to host the exiled Tibetan spiritual leader drew stern criticism from
China.





FULL STORY
















Russia opens poisoned spy probe





Russia's security agency has opened an espionage case in connection with
claims made by Andrei Lugovoi, the suspect named by Britain in the radiation
poisoning death of former agent Alexander Litvinenko in London last year, the
agency said Friday.

The triumph of the clear plastic bag





Recently I flew from New York to Hamburg, Germany, with a short layover in
London's Heathrow airport. Since I was going only for a couple of days, I had
no checked-in luggage; even so, British regulations require that anyone
transferring flights has to go through security again, so I got in the long
line with everyone else.





FULL STORY
















Overheated housing markets cool down





Some of the nation's most overheated housing markets may be cooling off to
more reasonable levels following their unprecedented run-up in the first half
of the decade.

It's right before bedtime and Sylvia is about to flip out about something --
that a page of her picture book is "broken" (read: torn, by her, days before)
and that she can't have three more handfuls of popcorn after we said "one
more."

When Will Nickelson and his daughter want to spend some quality time together,
they fire up Nintendo Co.'s Wii and play a few rounds of "Wii Sports" or

AT&T anti-piracy effort raises privacy concerns





In a break with other Internet service providers, AT&T Inc. will work with
Hollywood studios and recording labels to devise technology that identifies
offshore content pirates who use its network to upload illegal copies of
movies and music.

of his own at the Daytime Emmy Awards on Friday night.

Hasselhoff: I won custody fight with ex-wife





A beaming David Hasselhoff said Friday he had won a long-running battle with
ex-wife Pamela Bach over custody of his two teenage daughters.
